Detailed Description

Knots and Weights for Gaussian Quadrature calling routines from IQPACK

(c) 2005 Thomas Neff

void ExtendedTrapezoidalPoints ( int  n,
double  a,
double  b,
double  x[],
double  w[] 
)

Definition at line 239 of file gaussquad.c.

{
  int i;
  double h=(b-a)/(n-1);
  
  x[0] = a; x[n-1] = b;
  w[0] = 0.5*h; w[n-1] = 0.5*h;

  for (i=1; i<n-1; i++) {
    x[i] = a+i*h;
    w[i] = h;
  }
}

void GaussChebyshevPoints ( int  n,
double  a,
double  b,
double  x[],
double  w[] 
)

Divide weights by Chebyshev weight function.

Definition at line 76 of file gaussquad.c.

References cgqf(), and FORTRAN.

{
  int KIND=2;
  double T[n];
  double WTS[n];
  int LO=0;
  int NWF=2*n;
  double WF[NWF];
  int NIWF=2*n;
  int IWF[NIWF];
  int IER;

  FORTRAN(cgqf)(&n, T, WTS, &KIND, NULL, NULL, &a, &b, &LO,
                &NWF, WF, &NIWF, IWF, &IER);

  int i;
  for (i=0; i<n; i++) {
    x[i] = T[i];
    w[i] = WTS[i]/(pow((b-x[i])*(x[i]-a), -0.5));
  }

  if (IER) {
    fprintf(stderr, "CGQF error code: %d\n", IER);
  }
  
}

void GaussExponentialPoints ( int  n,
double  a,
double  b,
double  alpha,
double  x[],
double  w[] 
)

Divide weights by Exponential weight function.

Definition at line 139 of file gaussquad.c.

References cgqf(), and FORTRAN.

Referenced by _initangintegration(), and reinitangintegration().

{
  int KIND=7;
  double T[n];
  double WTS[n];
  int LO=0;
  int NWF=2*n;
  double WF[NWF];
  int NIWF=2*n;
  int IWF[NIWF];
  int IER;

  FORTRAN(cgqf)(&n, T, WTS, &KIND, &alpha, NULL, &a, &b, &LO,
                &NWF, WF, &NIWF, IWF, &IER);

  int i;
  for (i=0; i<n; i++) {
    x[i] = T[i];
    // don't use inf for x = (a+b)/2
    w[i] = (dabs(x[i]-0.5*(a+b))<1e-9 ? 0.0 : WTS[i]/(pow(dabs(x[i]-0.5*(a+b)), alpha)));
  }

  if (IER) {
    fprintf(stderr, "CGQF error code: %d\n", IER);
  }
  
}

void GaussGenHermitePoints ( int  n,
double  b,
double  x[],
double  w[] 
)

Divide weights by Gen. Hermite weight function integrate from 0 to infinity, therefore take only half of the points

Definition at line 207 of file gaussquad.c.

References cgqf(), FORTRAN, and N.

{
  int KIND=6;
  int N=2*n;
  double A=0.0;
  double ALPHA=2.0;
  double T[N];
  double WTS[N];
  int LO=0;
  int NWF=2*N;
  double WF[NWF];
  int NIWF=2*N;
  int IWF[NIWF];
  int IER;

  FORTRAN(cgqf)(&N, T, WTS, &KIND, &ALPHA, NULL, &A, &b, &LO,
                &NWF, WF, &NIWF, IWF, &IER);

  int i;
  for (i=0; i<n; i++) {
    x[i] = T[n+i];
    w[i] = WTS[n+i]/(pow(x[i],ALPHA)*exp(-b*dsqr(x[i])));
  }

  if (IER) {
    fprintf(stderr, "CGQF error code: %d\n", IER);
  }
  
}

void GaussJacobiPoints ( int  n,
double  a,
double  b,
double  alpha,
double  beta,
double  x[],
double  w[] 
)

Divide weights by Jacobi weight function.

Definition at line 107 of file gaussquad.c.

References cgqf(), and FORTRAN.

{
  int KIND=4;
  double T[n];
  double WTS[n];
  int LO=0;
  int NWF=2*n;
  double WF[NWF];
  int NIWF=2*n;
  int IWF[NIWF];
  int IER;

  FORTRAN(cgqf)(&n, T, WTS, &KIND, &alpha, &beta, &a, &b, &LO,
                &NWF, WF, &NIWF, IWF, &IER);

  int i;
  for (i=0; i<n; i++) {
    x[i] = T[i];
    w[i] = WTS[i]/(pow(b-x[i], alpha)*pow(x[i]-a, beta));
  }

  if (IER) {
    fprintf(stderr, "CGQF error code: %d\n", IER);
  }
  
}

double  x[],
double  w[] 
)

weight function 1

Definition at line 45 of file gaussquad.c.

References cgqf(), and FORTRAN.

Referenced by _initangintegration(), _initcmintegration(), calcMultipoleFormfactorsod(), calcOneNucleonOvlapsod(), calcTwoNucleonOvlapsTod(), calcTwoNucleonOvlapsYod(), initAngintegration(), reinitangintegration(), and reinitcmintegration().

{
  int KIND=1;
  double T[n];
  double WTS[n];
  int LO=0;
  int NWF=2*n;
  double WF[NWF];
  int NIWF=2*n;
  int IWF[NIWF];
  int IER;

  FORTRAN(cgqf)(&n, T, WTS, &KIND, NULL, NULL, &a, &b, &LO,
                &NWF, WF, &NIWF, IWF, &IER);

  int i;
  for (i=0; i<n; i++) {
    x[i] = T[i];
    w[i] = WTS[i];
  }

  if (IER) {
    fprintf(stderr, "CGQF error code: %d\n", IER);
  }
  
}

void GaussSqrHermitePoints ( int  n,
double  b,
double  x[],
double  w[] 
)

Definition at line 188 of file gaussquad.c.

References GPOINTS.

Referenced by _initcmintegration(), and reinitcmintegration().

{
  int ir;

  if (n>GPOINTS) {
    fprintf(stderr, "GaussSqrHermitePoints not yet implemented for n>%d\n", GPOINTS);
    return;
  }

  for (ir=0; ir<n; ir++) {
    x[ir] = rroots[n-1][ir]/sqrt(b);
    w[ir] = dsqr(rroots[n-1][ir])/b* rweights[n-1][ir]/sqrt(b);
  }
}

void ShiftedPeriodicTrapezoidalPoints ( int  n,
double  a,
double  b,
double  shift,
double  x[],
double  w[] 
)

Definition at line 255 of file gaussquad.c.

Referenced by _initangintegration(), _initcmintegration(), calcMultipoleFormfactorsod(), calcOneNucleonOvlapsod(), calcTwoNucleonOvlapsTod(), calcTwoNucleonOvlapsYod(), initAngintegration(), and reinitcmintegration().

{
  int i;
  double h = (b-a)/n;

  for (i=0; i<n; i++) {
    x[i] = a+ (i+shift)*h;
    w[i] = h;
  }
}
